oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Epidemiologic investigation of vesicular stomatitis in a dairy and its economic impact
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Leder, Robert R.
Maas, J.
Lane, V. Michael
Evermann, James F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Economics
Epidemiological surveys
vesicular stomatitis viruses
Viral diseases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An outbreak of vesicular stomatitis which occurred in a dairy herd in southwestern Idaho in 1982 was investigated. The virus spread in the herd despite the lack of insect vectors, and the vesicular stomatitis virus was isolated from saliva-contaminated water sources. Approximately 320 of 500 cows were affected, and the total estimated loss was approximately $50 000.
